channel.title: NPR Topics: Business
channel.description: Find the latest business news with reports on Wall Street, interest rates, banking, companies, and U.S. and world financial markets. Subscribe to the Business Story of the Day podcast.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: It was a rough year for nightclubs
item.description: A number of promenant nightclubs and music venues closed across the country in 2025, part of an ongoing trend driven by high rents, decreasing alcohol consumption and monopolization.
item.content:encoded: A number of promenant nightclubs and music venues closed across the country in 2025, part of an ongoing trend driven by high rents, decreasing alcohol consumption and monopolization.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Judge orders Trump administration to continue to seek funding for the CFPB
item.description: The order is the latest in a complex legal battle over the fate of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, a watchdog agency.
item.content:encoded:
The order is the latest in a complex legal battle over the fate of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, a watchdog agency.

(Image credit: SAUL LOEB)
item.dc:creator: Stephan Bisaha

item.title: Warren Buffett is retiring: We look back at a critical turning point in his career
item.description: Warren Buffett started out by identifying opportunities in undervalued companies. Later, his strategy was buying a company that would get bigger on its own. We look at that second phase of his career.
item.content:encoded: Warren Buffett started out by identifying opportunities in undervalued companies. Later, his strategy was buying a company that would get bigger on its own. We look at that second phase of his career.

item.title: Book distributor shutting down deals logistical blow to libraries
item.description: Baker and Taylor is among a few companies that act as the distribution middle man between libraries and publishers. The company's announcement that it is shutting down is a blow to librarians.
item.content:encoded: Baker and Taylor is among a few companies that act as the distribution middle man between libraries and publishers. The company's announcement that it is shutting down is a blow to librarians.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: FIFA president defends World Cup ticket prices, saying demand is hitting records
item.description: The FIFA President addressed outrage over ticket prices for the World Cup by pointing to record demand and reiterating that most of the proceeds will help support soccer around the world.
item.content:encoded:
The FIFA President addressed outrage over ticket prices for the World Cup by pointing to record demand and reiterating that most of the proceeds will help support soccer around the world.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: Electric vehicles had a bumpy road in 2025 — and one pleasant surprise
item.description: A suite of pro-EV federal policies have been reversed. Well-known vehicles have been discontinued. Sales plummeted. But interest is holding steady.
item.content:encoded:
A suite of pro-EV federal policies have been reversed. Well-known vehicles have been discontinued. Sales plummeted. But interest is holding steady.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Book distributor shutting down deals logistical blow to libraries
item.description: Baker and Taylor is one of very few companies that do book-distribution for libraries — companies that act as the middle man between libraries and publishers. But a few months ago, the company abruptly announced it was shutting down.
item.content:encoded: Baker and Taylor is one of very few companies that do book-distribution for libraries — companies that act as the middle man between libraries and publishers. But a few months ago, the company abruptly announced it was shutting down.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Memory loss: As AI gobbles up chips, prices for devices may rise
item.description: Demand for memory chips currently exceeds supply and there's little chance of that changing anytime soon. More chips for AI means fewer available for other products such as computers and phones. That could drive up those prices too.
item.content:encoded:
Demand for memory chips currently exceeds supply and there's little chance of that changing anytime soon. More chips for AI means fewer available for other products such as computers and phones. That could drive up those prices too.

(Image credit: Charlie Litchfield)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Marijuana rescheduling would bring some immediate changes, but others will take time
item.description: President Trump set the process in motion to ease federal restrictions on marijuana. But his order doesn't automatically revoke laws targeting marijuana, which remains illegal to transport over state lines.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump set the process in motion to ease federal restrictions on marijuana. But his order doesn't automatically revoke laws targeting marijuana, which remains illegal to transport over state lines.

(Image credit: Charlie Riedel)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Clean energy is surging despite political attacks. But a slowdown may be looming
item.description: The U.S. is forecast to add a lot less power from renewables than analysts previously expected. The potential slowdown comes as electricity demand is rising faster than it has in decades.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. is forecast to add a lot less power from renewables than analysts previously expected. The potential slowdown comes as electricity demand is rising faster than it has in decades.

(Image credit: John Locher)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley
